Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Brittany M Blount was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: With credit for 1 day served. Huber privileges for childcare.
Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 10/18/22.

miscConds.notes:
- Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- Court set restitution at zero.

- Complete a course in anger management.
- Complete Parenting Classes.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- Provide a DNA sample.

- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brittany M Blount

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brittany M Blount in court.  Attorney Travis Schwantes in court for Brittany M Blount.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Plea and sentencing hearing held. State has filed an AMENDED information. Defense counsel acknowledges receipt, waives reading, and enters a temporary not guilty plea. Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 1 day served. Huber privileges for childcare.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Complete a course in anger management.
- Complete Parenting Classes.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- Complete 25 hours of community service.
- Obtain GED/HSED.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

- Court set restitution at zero.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 10/18/22.

Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.

Defendant Brittany M Blount in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel advises that they are in a resolution posture. Case adjourned for a Plea/Sentencing hearing to Br 29.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Brittany M Blount in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Lauren Marowsky - MPD Police Officer. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brittany M Blount in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State's witness is not present and State requests an adjournment. Defense moves to dismiss. Court DENIES defense's motion to dismiss and GRANTS state's request for an adjournment. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JJJ UNLESS the visitation is pursuant to DMCPS discretion, or Childrens Court TPC/Dispositional Order (whichever is superseding). If DMCPS closes out their investigation and Childrens Court has no open orders, this order is to convert into a No Violent Contact Order.

Defendant Brittany M Blount in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 29.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/31/2022@2:30p
